page.title: 14Pineham Bottom Farm
page.content: The farm covers 150 acres mostly devoted to animal and poultry. The arable farming consists of barley and oats grown partly to sell and feed. The main activity is pig farming. There are about 150 pigs reared to a weight of 250lbs. This takes 12-18 months. They are then sold to Bowyers in Wiltshire where they are made into pork pies and sausages. The poultry consists of hens, bantoms and geese and are reared for eggs and as pets. One field is used to graze 2 donkeys and a shetland pony. Another contains poultry and 12 goats. Four sheep are kept and one yielded a fleece of wool 16lbs in weight. The main flock of about 700 sheep is grazed on land over a 15 mile radius. A herd of bullocks is sent to Ashley, 3 miles away for summer grazing. This farm does not use intensive "factory farming" methods.
